snippet: A New York State judge should not allow lawmakers to skew the wording on a ballot in a way that tips the scales in favor of a pro-gambling outcome.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New York Gov Andrew Cuomo and State Legislature for trying to skew language on ballot in a way that tips scales in favor of pro-gambling outcome in a vote to decide whether to allow seven new casinos to open; urges State Supreme Court Judge Richard Platkin to remedy that error when he hears a complaint about wording of the ballot.
lead_paragraph: A New York State judge should not allow lawmakers to skew the wording on a ballot in a way that tips the scales in favor of a pro-gambling outcome.
